headline: MSNBC will become MS NOW, lose peacock logo before Comcast spinoff
summary: STORY: Cable news channel MSNBC is changing its name, calling itself MS NOW or My Source for News, Opinion and the World.That's according to internal memos seen by Reuters on Monday.The rebranding comes as parent Comcast moves ahead with its planned spinoff of many of its NBCUniversal cable networks, including CNBC and USA, into a separate company called Versant later this year.It's all part of a significant shift in strategy toward streaming networks.The cable channels will also lose the iconic peacock logo associated with NBCUniversal, according to a Versant memo.Comcast intends to retain the legacy NBC broadcast network, and its film and television studios, which are expected to fuel growth for the Peacock streaming service.Launched in 1996, MSNBC stands for Microsoft and National Broadcasting Company, a name formed through its previous partnership with Microsoft and NBC.The name has outlived its time since Microsoft pulled out of the joint venture that owned MSNBC in 2012.The network is the latest media company to undergo a rebranding.In 2023, Warner Bros Discovery changed the name of streaming service HBO Max to just Max, only to revert back to HBO Max.:: people.incAnd IAC-owned publisher Dotdash Meredith recently rebranded as People, Inc.
